table:table-cell.text:p: (The type of procedure is determined by the legal basis proposed in the draft act.)
Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs
Committee on Employment and Social Affairs
Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety
Committee on Industry, Research and Energy
Committee on the Internal Market and Consumer Protection
Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development
Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs
Committee on Women’s Rights and Gender Equality
Group of the European People’s Party (Christian Democrats)
Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament
Group of the Greens / European Free Alliance
The Left Group in the European Parliament – GUE/NGL

text:p.Orator.ChangeOfPresident.Text: IN THE CHAIR: David Maria SASSOLIPresident

PV.Session.Resumption.Text.text:p: The session adjourned on Thursday 25 November 2021 was resumed.

PV.Other.Text.text:p: The sitting opened at 17.03.

PV.Statement.Text.text:p: The President made a statement on the terrorist attack that shocked the city of Strasbourg on 11 December 2018. He recalled our duty to defend the values and freedoms that are the foundation of our pluralist, diverse and inclusive society.
Parliament observed a minute’s silence in memory of the victims.

PV.Approval.Text.text:h: 4Approval of the minutes of the previous sittings
PV.Approval.Text.text:p: The minutes of the sittings of 23, 24, 25 and 26 November 2021 were approved.

PV.Deposit.Text.text:p:
Johan Danielsson
had given notice of his appointment as the Swedish Government’s Minister for Housing and Deputy Minister for Employment.

Parliament noted that, pursuant to Article 7(1) of the Act of 20 September 1976 concerning the election of the members of the European Parliament by direct universal suffrage, the office was incompatible with that of Member of the European Parliament, and pursuant to Rule 3(2)(2), and Rule 4 (1) and (4), Parliament established that the seat would be vacant as of 30 November 2021.

Evelyne Gebhardt
had given notice in writing of her resignation as a Member of Parliament, with effect from 2 February 2022.
Pursuant to Rule 4(1), (2) and (6), Parliament established the vacancy of her seat with effect from that date and informed the relevant national authorities thereof.

The German authorities had given notice of the election of Karsten Lucke to replace
Norbert Neuser
as Member of Parliament with effect from 11 January 2022.
Parliament took note of his election.

Under Rule 3(2), until such time as his credentials had been verified or a ruling had been given on any dispute, and provided that he had previously made a written declaration stating that he did not hold any office incompatible with that of Member of the European Parliament, Karsten Lucke would take his seat in Parliament and on its bodies and would enjoy all the rights attaching thereto.

PV.Membership.Text.text:p:
Michal Wiezik
was no longer a member of the PPE Group and had joined the Renew Group as of 8 December 2021.

Dorien Rookmaker
was no longer sitting with the non-attached Members and had joined the ECR Group as of 8 December 2021.

PV.Other.Text.text:p: The S&D, Renew and ID groups had notified the President of the following decisions changing the composition of committees and delegations:

Committee on Foreign Affairs:
Jörg Meuthen
to replace
Maximilian Krah

Committee on Budgetary Control:
Michal Wiezik
to replace
Martina Dlabajová

Committee on Petitions:
Monica Semedo
was no longer a member

Delegation for Northern cooperation and for relations with Switzerland and Norway and to the EU-Iceland Joint Parliamentary Committee and the European Economic Area (EEA) Joint Parliamentary Committee:
Erik Bergkvist
The decisions took effect as of that day.

PV.Other.Text.text:h: 8 Negotiations ahead of Parliament ’ s first reading (Rule 71)
PV.Other.Text.text:p: The ECON and PECH committees had decided to enter into interinstitutional negotiations in accordance with Rule 71, on the basis of the following reports:

- ECON Committee: proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on digital operational resilience for the financial sector and amending Regulations (EC) No 1060/2009, (EU) No 648/2012, (EU) No 600/2014 and (EU) No 909/2014 (COM(2020)0595 – C9-0304/2020 – 2020/0266(COD)) – Rapporteur: Billy Kelleher ( A9-0341/2021);

- ECON Committee: proposal for a directive of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directives 2006/43/EC, 2009/65/EC, 2009/138/EU, 2011/61/EU, 2013/36/EU, 2014/65/EU, (EU) 2015/2366 and (EU) 2016/2341 ( COM(2020)0596 – C9-0303/2020 – 2020/0268(COD)) – Rapporteur: Mikuláš Peksa ( A9-0340/2021);

- PECH Committee: proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down management, conservation and control measures applicable in the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (IOTC) Area of Competence, amending Council Regulations (EC) No 1936/2001, (EC) No 1984/2003 and (EC) No 520/2007 ( COM(2021)0113 – C9-0095/2021 – 2021/0058(COD)) – Rapporteur: Gabriel Mato ( A9-0312/2021).
In accordance with Rule 71(2), requests for the decisions to be put to the vote could be submitted until midnight the following day, 14 December 2021.
Negotiations may start at any time after that deadline has expired if no request for a vote on the decision to enter into negotiations has been made.

PV.Other.Text.text:h: 9Signing of acts adopted in accordance with the ordinary legislative procedure (Rule 79)
PV.Other.Text.text:p: Since the adjournment of the session on 25 November 2021, the President of Parliament, together with the President of the Council, had signed the following acts adopted under the ordinary legislative procedure:

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing rules on support for strategic plans to be drawn up by Member States under the common agricultural policy (CAP strategic plans) and financed by the European Agricultural Guarantee Fund (EAGF) and by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) and repealing Regulations (EU) No 1305/2013 and (EU) No 1307/2013 (00064/2021/LEX - C9-0444/2021 - 2018/0216(COD))
;

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the financing, management and monitoring of the common agricultural policy and repealing Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013 (00065/2021/LEX - C9-0442/2021 - 2018/0217(COD))
;

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulations (EU) No 1308/2013 establishing a common organisation of the markets in agricultural products, (EU) No 1151/2012 on quality schemes for agricultural products and foodstuffs, (EU) No 251/2014 on the definition, description, presentation, labelling and the protection of geographical indications of aromatised wine products and (EU) No 228/2013 laying down specific measures for agriculture in the outermost regions of the Union (00066/2021/LEX - C9-0443/2021 - 2018/0218(COD))
.
On 15 December 2021, the President of Parliament, together with the President of the Council, would sign the following acts adopted under the ordinary legislative procedure:

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the European Union Agency for Asylum and repealing Regulation (EU) No 439/2010 (00061/2021/LEX - C9-0459/2021 - 2016/0131(COD))
;

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EU) 2015/848 on insolvency proceedings to replace its Annexes A and B (00073/2021/LEX - C9-0460/2021 - 2021/0118(COD))
;

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EU) No 1286/2014 as regards the extension of the transitional arrangement for management companies, investment companies and persons advising on, or selling, units of undertakings for collective investment in transferable securities (UCITS) and non-UCITS (00071/2021/LEX - C9-0462/2021 - 2021/0215(COD))
;

- Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directive 2009/65/EC as regards the use of key information documents by management companies of undertakings for collective investment in transferable securities (UCITS) (00072/2021/LEX - C9-0463/2021 - 2021/0219(COD))
;

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EU) 2018/1091 as regards the Union contribution for integrated farm statistics under Council Regulation (EU, Euratom) 2020/2093 laying down the multiannual financial framework for the years 2021 to 2027 (00070/2021/LEX - C9-0464/2021 - 2021/0270(COD))
;

- Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on health technology assessment and amending Directive 2011/24/EU (00080/2021/LEX - C9-0452/2021 - 2018/0018(COD))
.
The Commission communications on the action taken on the resolutions adopted by Parliament during the May and July part-sessions in 2021 were available on Parliament’s website.
The following questions for oral answer with debate had been placed on the agenda (Rule 136):

-
O-000072/2021
by
Anna Cavazzini
, on behalf of the IMCO Committee, to the Commission: Barriers to the free movement of goods ( B9-0043/2021)
;

-
O-000073/2021
by
Bernd Lange
, on behalf of the INTA Committee, to the Commission: Implementation of the Kimberley Process Certification Scheme (B9-0044/2021)
;

-
O-000074/2021
by
Evelyn Regner
, on behalf of the FEMM Committee, to the Commission: MeToo and harassment – the consequences for the EU institutions (B9-0045/2021)
.

PV.Deposit.Text.text:p: The following documents had been received:
1) from other institutions

- Proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on measures against transport operators that facilitate or engage in trafficking in persons or smuggling of migrants in relation to illegal entry into the territory of the European Union ( COM(2021)0753 - C9-0431/2021 -
2021/0387(COD)
The President would consult the European Economic and Social Committee and the Committee of the Regions on this proposal, in accordance with Rule 145(1) and Rule 146(1).

- Proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the transparency and targeting of political advertising (COM(2021)0731 – C9-0433/2021 – 2021/0381(COD)) The President would consult the European Economic and Social Committee on this proposal, in accordance with Rule 145(1).

- Proposal for a directive of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down for certain road vehicles circulating within the Union the maximum authorised dimensions in national and international traffic and the maximum authorised weights in international traffic (codification) ( COM(2021)0769 – C9-0453/2021 – 2021/0400(COD)) The President would consult the European Economic and Social Committee and the Committee of the Regions on this proposal, in accordance with Rule 145(1) and Rule 146(1).
- Proposal for a Council directive amending Directive 2006/112/EC as regards rates of value added tax – General approach (14754/2021 – C9-0456/2021 – 2018/0005(CNS))
2) from committees
2.1) reports

- ***I Report on the proposal for a directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on measures for a high common level of cybersecurity across the Union, repealing Directive (EU) 2016/1148 ( COM(2020)0823 – C9-0422/2020 – 2020/0359(COD)) – ITRE Committee – Rapporteur: Bart Groothuis (A9-0313/2021)

- Report on the evaluation of preventive measures for avoiding corruption, irregular spending and misuse of EU and national funds in case of emergency funds and crisis-related spending areas ( 2020/2222(INI)) – CONT Committee – Rapporteur: Michèle Rivasi ( A9-0320/2021)
- Report on the implementation of the Energy Performance of Buildings Directive ( 2021/2077(INI)) – ITRE Committee – Rapporteur: Seán Kelly ( A9-0321/2021)

- ***I Report on Proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on a European Year of Youth 2022 (COM(2021)0634 – C9-0379/2021 – 2021/0328(COD)) – CULT Committee – Rapporteur: Sabine Verheyen (A9-0322/2021)
- Report on the deliberations of the Committee on Petitions in 2020 ( 2021/2019(INI)) – PETI Committee – Rapporteur: Gheorghe Falcă ( A9-0323/2021)
- Report on the challenges and prospects for multilateral weapons of mass destruction arms control and disarmament regimes (2020/2001(INI)) – AFET Committee – Rapporteur: Sven Mikser (A9-0324/2021)

- ***I Report on the proposal for a directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on the adequate minimum wages in the European Union (COM(2020)0682 – C9-0337/2020 – 2020/0310(COD)) – EMPL Committee – Rapporteurs: Dennis Radtke, Agnes Jongerius (A9-0325/2021)
- Report on new orientations for the EU’s humanitarian action ( 2021/2163(INI)) – DEVE Committee – Rapporteur: Norbert Neuser ( A9-0328/2021)

- Report on the impact of organised crime on own resources of the EU and on the misuse of EU funds with a particular focus on shared management from an auditing and control perspective ( 2020/2221(INI)) – CONT Committee – Rapporteur: Tomáš Zdechovský ( A9-0330/2021)

- Report on democracy at work: a European framework for employees’ participation rights and the revision of the European Works Council Directive (2021/2005(INI)) – EMPL Committee – Rapporteur: Gabriele Bischoff (A9-0331/2021)

- ***I Report on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on contestable and fair markets in the digital sector (Digital Markets Act) ( COM(2020)0842 – C9-0419/2020 – 2020/0374(COD)) – IMCO Committee – Rapporteur: Andreas Schwab (A9-0332/2021)

- ***I Report on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Regulation (EU) 2019/216 of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards Union tariff rate quota for high quality beef from Paraguay (COM(2021)0313 – C9-0228/2021 – 2021/0146(COD)) – INTA Committee – Rapporteur: Jordi Cañas (A9-0333/2021)

- *** Recommendation on the draft Council decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the Protocol to amend the Air Transport Agreement between the United States of America and the European Community and its Member States (06385/2021 – C9-0368/2021 – 2010/0112(NLE)) – TRAN Committee – Rapporteur: Maria Grapini ( A9-0335/2021)

- ***I Second report on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the access of third-country goods and services to the Union’s internal market in public procurement and procedures supporting negotiations on access of Union goods and services to the public procurement markets of third countries (COM(2016)0034 – C8-0018/2016 – 2012/0060(COD)) – INTA Committee – Rapporteur: Daniel Caspary (A9-0337/2021)

- Report with recommendations to the Commission on combating gender-based violence: cyberviolence ( 2020/2035(INL)) – LIBE Committee – FEMM Committee – Rapporteur: Sylwia Spurek – Rapporteur: Elissavet Vozemberg-Vrionidi (A9-0338/2021)

- ***I Report on the proposal for a directive of the European Parliament and of the Council amending Directives 2006/43/EC, 2009/65/EC, 2009/138/EU, 2011/61/EU, EU/2013/36, 2014/65/EU, (EU) 2015/2366 and EU/2016/2341 ( COM(2020)0596 – C9-0303/2020 – 2020/0268(COD)) – ECON Committee – Rapporteur: Mikuláš Peksa (A9-0340/2021)

- ***I Report on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on digital operational resilience for the financial sector and amending Regulations (EC) No 1060/2009, (EU) No 648/2012, (EU) No 600/2014 and (EU) No 909/2014 (COM(2020)0595 – C9-0304/2020 – 2020/0266(COD)) – ECON Committee – Rapporteur: Billy Kelleher (A9-0341/2021)

- Report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilisation of the European Union Solidarity Fund to provide assistance to Croatia in relation to the series of earthquakes starting from 28 December 2020 ( COM(2021)0963 – C9-0403/2021 – 2021/0359(BUD)) – BUDG Committee – Rapporteur: Karlo Ressler (A9-0343/2021)

- Report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Displaced Workers following an application from Spain – EGF/2021/004 ES Aragon automotive (COM(2021)0683 – C9-0404/2021 – 2021/0356(BUD)) – BUDG Committee – Rapporteur: Esteban González Pons (A9-0344/2021)

- Report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Displaced Workers following an application from Italy – EGF/2021/003 IT Porto Canale (COM(2021)0935 – C9-0399/2021 – 2021/0337(BUD)) – BUDG Committee – Rapporteur: Janusz Lewandowski (A9-0345/2021)

- Report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund for Displaced Workers following an application from Italy – EGF/2021/002 IT/Air Italy (COM(2021)0936 – C9-0400/2021 – 2021/0338(BUD)) – BUDG Committee – Rapporteur: Janusz Lewandowski (A9-0346/2021)

- * Report on the proposal for a Council regulation amending Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 609/2014 in order to enhance predictability for Member States and to clarify procedures for dispute resolution when making available the traditional, VAT and GNI based own resources ( COM(2021)0327 – C9-0257/2021 – 2021/0161(NLE)) – BUDG Committee – Rapporteurs: José Manuel Fernandes, Valérie Hayer ( A9-0347/2021)
2.2) recommendation for second reading

- ***II Recommendation for second reading on the Council position at first reading with a view to the adoption of a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on health technology assessment and amending Directive 2011/24/EU (10531/3/2021 – C9-0422/2021 – 2018/0018(COD)) – ENVI Committee – Rapporteur: Tiemo Wölken ( A9-0334/2021)

PV.Other.Text.text:p: The final draft agenda for the plenary sittings of December 2021 ( PE 702.619/PDOJ ) had been made available to Members and the following changes had been proposed (Rule 158):
The President announced that he had received a request for urgent procedure (Rule 163) concerning the following legislative file:

- Transitional provisions for certain in vitro diagnostic medical devices and deferred application of requirements for in-house devices (COM(2021)0627 - C9-0381/2021- 2021/0323(COD)) (final draft agenda, item 103).
This request would be put to the vote at that day's voting session.
The President also announced that no motions to reject or amend the Council's following position at first reading had been tabled pursuant to Rules 67 and 68:
- Health technology assessment (final draft agenda, item 140).
The vote on the amendments to the recommendation for the second reading scheduled for Tuesday's voting session was thus no longer necessary.

The votes would be spread over the various voting sessions depending on the number of amendments and requests for split and separate votes. Information on the manner in which the votes would be spread over the various voting sessions was available on Parliament’s website under ‘Priority information and documents’.
The House agreed to the changes.
The order of business was thus established.

The following spoke:
Joachim Kuhs
.

text:h.OJ.ReportShortDescription.Text: The 30th anniversary of the dissolution of the Soviet Union and its importance for the future of Russia and Europe

The President made the statement.

The following spoke: Rasa Juknevičienė, on behalf of the PPE Group, Juozas Olekas, on behalf of the S&D Group, Bernard Guetta, on behalf of the Renew Group, Sergey Lagodinsky, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Nicolaus Fest, on behalf of the ID Group, Anna Fotyga, on behalf of the ECR Group
,
Martin Schirdewan
, on behalf of The Left Group, and Kostas Papadakis, non-attached Member
.
The debate closed.

.

Rapporteur: Jordi Cañas (A9-0333/2021)
.
The ballot would be open until 19.45.
The vote was taken.

text:p.OJ.PresentationCommission.Text: Recommendation for second reading on the Council position at first reading with a view to the adoption of a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on health technology assessment and amending Directive 2011/24/EU [10531/3/2021 - C9-0422/2021 - 2018/0018(COD)] - Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety. Rapporteur: Tiemo Wölken ( A9-0334/2021)

PV.Other.Text.text:p:

introduced the recommendation for second reading.

The following spoke:
Stella Kyriakides (Member of the Commission)
.

The following spoke: Nathalie Colin-Oesterlé, on behalf of the PPE Group, Jytte Guteland, on behalf of the S&D Group, Véronique Trillet-Lenoir, on behalf of the Renew Group, Michèle Rivasi, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Markus Buchheit, on behalf of the ID Group, Joanna Kopcińska, on behalf of the ECR Group

and

The President announced that no proposals to reject or amend the Council’s position at first reading had been tabled pursuant to Rules 67 and 68.
The Council position was therefore deemed approved.
(‘Results of votes’ annex, item 1)

.
The item closed.

Vote:
minutes of 14.12.2021, item 7
(amendments);
minutes of 15.12.2021, item 10
(final vote).

Announcement of voting results:
minutes of 14.12.2021, item 15
(amendments);
minutes of 15.12.2021, item 17
(final vote).

PV.Other.Text.text:h: 24One-minute speeches on matters of political importance
PV.Other.Text.text:p: In accordance with Rule 172, the following Members who wished to draw Parliament’s attention to matters of political importance spoke for one minute:

Fulvio Martusciello, Vlad-Marius Botoş, Maxette Pirbakas, Michiel Hoogeveen, João Pimenta Lopes, Michaela Šojdrová, Billy Kelleher, Charlie Weimers, Sandra Pereira, Eugen Tomac, José Gusmão, Peter Pollák, Clare Daly and Mick Wallace
.
Written explanations of vote:
Explanations of vote submitted in writing under Rule 194 appear on the Members’ pages on Parliament’s website.
Exceptionally, explanations of vote of a maximum of 400 words would be accepted.

Corrections to votes and voting intentions appear on Parliament’s website under ‘Results of roll-call votes’ as an annex to the minutes of the sitting. They are for information only and have no effect on the result of the vote as announced in plenary.
The document will be regularly updated in the two weeks following the part-session concerned.
After those two weeks, the list of corrections to votes and voting intentions will be finalised so that it can be translated and published in the Official Journal.

PV.Agenda.Text.text:p: The agenda of the next day’s sitting had been established ( ‘Agenda’ PE 702.619/OJMA).

PV.Other.Text.text:p: The sitting closed at 21.30.

PV.AttendanceRegister.AttendanceRegister.Disclaimer.Text: Owing to the COVID-19 pandemic, a remote voting system had been introduced (see Bureau Decision of 20 March 2020 supplementing its Decision of 3 May 2004 on rules governing voting). The Members who voted are listed in the ‘Results of roll-call votes’ document, which is annexed to the minutes of the sitting and available on Parliament’s website.
